l:dependency.name: Test Management for Jira
l:dependency.l:description: Integration with Test Management for Jira (by Adaptavist), for automatic publishing of test results.

l:dependency.name: JCIP Annotations under Apache License
l:dependency.l:description: A clean room implementation of the JCIP Annotations based entirely on the specification provided by the javadocs.

l:dependency.name: ASM Core
l:dependency.l:description: A very small and fast Java bytecode manipulation framework

l:dependency.name: JSON Small and Fast Parser
l:dependency.l:description: JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is a lightweight data-interchange format. It is easy for humans to read and write. It is easy for machines to parse and generate. It is based on a subset of the JavaScript Programming Language, Standard ECMA-262 3rd Edition - December 1999. JSON is a text format that is completely language independent but uses conventions that are familiar to programmers of the C-family of languages, including C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, Perl, Python, and many others. These properties make JSON an ideal data-interchange language.

l:dependency.name: Apache HttpClient Mime
l:dependency.l:description: Apache HttpComponents HttpClient - MIME coded entities

l:dependency.name: Nimbus JOSE+JWT
l:dependency.l:description: Java library for Javascript Object Signing and Encryption (JOSE) and JSON Web Tokens (JWT)

l:dependency.name: ASM based accessors helper used by json-smart
l:dependency.l:description: Java reflect give poor performance on getter setter an constructor calls, accessors-smart use ASM to speed up those calls.

l:dependency.name: JSON in Java
l:dependency.l:description:
JSON is a light-weight, language independent, data interchange format. See http://www.JSON.org/
The files in this package implement JSON encoders/decoders in Java. It also includes the capability to convert between JSON and XML, HTTP headers, Cookies, and CDL.
This is a reference implementation. There is a large number of JSON packages in Java. Perhaps someday the Java community will standardize on one. Until then, choose carefully.
The license includes this restriction: "The software shall be used for good, not evil." If your conscience cannot live with that, then choose a different package.

l:dependency.name: Apache Commons Codec
l:dependency.l:description: The Apache Commons Codec package contains simple encoder and decoders for various formats such as Base64 and Hexadecimal. In addition to these widely used encoders and decoders, the codec package also maintains a collection of phonetic encoding utilities.
